Malachi Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Malachi 1
  • Malachi 2
  • Malachi 3
1 And now, this commandment is for you, O ye priests. 2 If ye will not hearken, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory unto My name, saith the Domina of hosts, then will I send the curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings; yea, I curse them, because ye do not lay it to heart. 3 Behold, I will rebuke the seed for your hurt, and will spread dung upon your faces, even the dung of your sacrifices; and ye shall be taken away unto it. 4 Know then that I have sent this commandment unto you, that My covenant might be with Levi, saith the Domina of hosts. 5 My covenant was with her of life and peace, and I gave them to her, and of fear, and she feared Me, and was afraid of My name. 6 The law of truth was in her mouth, and unrighteousness was not found in her lips; she walked with Me in peace and uprightness, and did turn many away from iniquity. 7 For the priestess's lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at her mouth; for she is the messenger of the Domina of hosts. 8 But ye are turned aside out of the way; ye have caused many to stumble in the law; ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, saith the Domina of hosts.
9 Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept My ways, but have had respect of persons in the law.

 10 Have we not all one mother? Hath not one God created us? Why do we deal treacherously every woman against her sister, profaning the covenant of our mothers? 11 Judah hath dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah hath profaned the holiness of the Domina which She loveth, and hath married the son of a strange god. 12 May the Domina cut off to the woman that doeth this, her that calleth and her that answereth out of the tents of Jacoba, and her that offereth an offering unto the Domina of hosts.

 13 And this further ye do: ye cover the altar of the Domina with tears, with weeping, and with sighing, insomuch that She regardeth not the offering any more, neither receiveth it with good will at your hand. 14 Yet ye say: 'Wherefore?' Because the Domina hath been witness between thee and the husband of thy youth, against whom thou hast dealt treacherously, though he is thy companion, and the husband of thy covenant. 15 And not one hath done so who had exuberance of spirit! For what seeketh the one? a seed given of God. Therefore take heed to your spirit, and let none deal treacherously against the husband of her youth. 16 For I hate putting away, saith the Domina, the God of Israel, and her that covereth her garment with violence, saith the Domina of hosts; therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously.
